section.title: CAG 20 Critical Security Controls v2.3
section.subtitle: Twenty Critical Controls for Effective Cyber Defense: Consensus Audit Guidelines (CAG)

abstract.quote: This consensus document of 20 crucial controls is designed to begin the process of establishing that prioritized baseline of information security measures and controls. The consensus effort that has produced this document has identified 20 specific technical security controls that are viewed as effective in blocking currently known high-priority attacks, as well as those attack types expected in the near future. Fifteen of these controls can be monitored, at least in part, automatically and continuously. The consensus effort has also identified a second set of five controls that are essential but that do not appear to be able to be monitored continuously or automatically with current technology and practices. Each of the 20 control areas includes multiple individual subcontrols, each specifying actions an organization can take to help improve its defenses.

para.literallayout: 20 Total number of line items in guideline 5 Items at least partially addressed by OS Lockdown 15 Items not addressed by OS Lockdown

table.title: Guideline name/description for CAG 20 Critical Security Controls v2.3

row.entry: Secure Configurations for Hardware and Software on Laptops, Workstations, and Servers
Maintenance, Monitoring, and Analysis of Audit Logs
Limitation and Control of Network Ports, Protocols, and Services

table.title: Module to line item breakdown for CAG 20 Critical Security Controls v2.3

entry.xref: Correct Global Init Script PATH Variables
Correct System RC Script PATH Variables
Deny NFS Client Access Without UID or GID
Disable Login Prompts on Serial Ports
Disable SNMP if default public string exists
Disable Support for USB Storage devices
Enable Strong TCP Sequence Number Generation
Ignore ICMP ECHO and TIMESTAMP Requests
Limit Access To Root From Su
Lock account after three failed login attempts
Name Service Switch Configuration File Permissions
No Plus Entries in Password Files
Remove Insecure_Locks option for NFS Server
Restrict Use of Traceroute and Ping
Restrict the CDE Subprocess Control Service
Root shell must be on / filesystem
SSHD Print Last Login by User
SSHD Set Idle Timeout Interval for User Logins
Set Password Aging on Active Accounts
Set X Screen Saver Application Defaults
Use NODEV Option for Non-root Partitions
Use NOSUID and NODEV for Removable Media
